section: This Services Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into on October 1, 2019 and is made effective as of November 1, 2019 (the "Effective Date")
explanation: The contract states it is 'entered into' on October 1, 2019, but the 'Effective Date' is November 1, 2019. This discrepancy creates ambiguity as to when the obligations and rights under the agreement actually commence. It's unclear whether actions taken between October 1 and November 1 are covered by this agreement.

section: Recipient shall own, all rights, title, and interest in any invention, technique, process, device, discovery, improvement, or know-how, whether patentable or not and all other proprietary rights, industrial rights and any other similar rights, in each case on a worldwide basis, and all copies and tangible embodiments thereof, or any part thereof, in whatever form or medium hereafter made or conceived solely by Provider, if both parties agree it is related to the services.
explanation: This section creates an ambiguity because it states that Recipient owns all rights to inventions made by the Provider if both parties agree it is related to the services. This is a conditional assignment. It's unclear what happens if the parties disagree on whether the invention relates to the services or if one party refuses to agree. The conditionality weakens the assignment and creates uncertainty.

section: This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.
explanation: This sentence is structurally flawed and contains repeated text. The phrase 'Agreement' appears redundantly and does not make sense in the context of the sentence. The structure of the sentence is difficult to parse, and it should be rephrased for clarity.
